# init(_:)

**Initializer**

Creates an environment property to read the specified key path.

## Declaration

```swift
init(_ keyPath: KeyPath<EnvironmentValues, Value>)
```

## Parameters

- **keyPath**: A key path to a specific resulting value.

## Discussion

Don’t call this initializer directly. Instead, declare a property with the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment] property wrapper, and provide the key path of the environment value that the property should reflect:

```swift
struct MyView: View {
    @Environment(\.colorScheme) var colorScheme: ColorScheme

    // ...
}
```

SwiftUI automatically updates any parts of `MyView` that depend on the property when the associated environment value changes. You can’t modify the environment value using a property like this. Instead, use the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/environment(_:_:)] view modifier on a view to set a value for a view hierarchy.
